at most 14 mm

states.1: stout (coxal plates more deep than wide)
states.2: slender (coxal plates as deep as wide or wider than deeper)
with setae

states.1: seven spines, inner often multidenticulated, other with 1-2 denticles
states.2: seven spines, all multidenticulated
states.3: more than seven spines, inner often multidenticulated, other with 1-2 denticles

states.2: at least two setae
postero-facial and postero-distal group of setae
mid-size to small
strongly trapezoid - hoof shaped
two or more supporting spines

states.1: at least two setae on outer margin
states.2: single seta on outer margin

states.1: single robust seta at the base of nail
states.2: at least two robust setae in proximal part of dactylus

states.1: single robust seta at the base of nail
states.2: at least two robust setae in proximal part of dactylus

states.1: single robust seta at the base of uropod I
states.2: at least two robust setae at the base of uropod I (in a row)

states.1: single seta, thin or robust, but neither curved nor placed on socket
states.2: single, strong, curved robust seta on a socket
states.3: more than one seta, robust or thin

states.2: with robust setae

with at least one dorsal spine
more than two hooks in retinacles at least in one pleopod pair

states.1: sexually non-dimorphic, inner ramus at most 1.2 as long as outer ramus
states.2: sexually dimorphic, inner ramus remarkably elongated than outer ramus (proportion 1: 1.3)

states.1: sexually dimorphic, both articles of outer ramus distinctly elongated in males
states.2: sexually non-dimorphic, distal article of outer ramus shorter than 0.1 of proximal article
